todos.title: Timing
todos.body: Will your product make sense in the world in which it was finished and not just the world in which it started?

todos.title: Autonomy
todos.body: Is your structure self-organizing, independent, de-centralized, non-political, non-emotional, team oriented, non-hierarchical (are there systems to remove the weakest links such as voting, or performance metrics, pay people to leave, peer-based, teams select own employees)?

todos.title: Disruption
todos.body: Is your product a disruption to an already established product?  * Disruption is bad if it causes to much attention and competitors flood the market.

todos.title: Data Driven
todos.body: Is your company data driven (use data to help guide decisions, not make decisions, including in human resources)?

todos.title: Board Managed
todos.body: Is your board managed properly  board is diverse (diverse boards outperform all-white-male boards by 26% according to study by Credit Suisse Research Institute), board brings in outside sources and young people to update them on new technologies, board participates in continuing ed, board removes weakest link?

todos.title: Information
todos.body: Is information your greatest asset?

todos.title: Relevant Communities
todos.body: Have you joined relevant communities of people that will help you with your objective (www.meetup.com, accelerators, incubators, associations, blogs, hacker-spaces, universities, etc.)?

todos.title: Business Model
todos.body: Does your product provide min of two and max of three of the following value propositions  immediacy (helps customers be the first to experience/know something), personalization (customers can personalize their experience), interpretation (helps shorten learning curve), authenticity (product is guaranteed to be real and safe), accessibility (improves our ability to find what we need quickly), embodiment (has a physical component to it, we receive something tangible), patronage (people want to pay the artist entrepreneur when they could get it for free through piracy), findability (helps customers broadcast their existence so that other people can find them)?

todos.title: Collaborative Consumption
todos.body: Does your product or systems take advantage of sharing resources (such as Uber, Airbnb, etc.)?

todos.title: Sensors
todos.body: Does your product or infrastructure include sensors for measurement?

todos.title: Doubling Pattern
todos.body: Does your product improve because of Moore’s Doubling pattern (better, cheaper, and greater access to technology?

todos.title: Lean Startup
todos.body: Does your company eliminate all expenses with any goal other than the creation of value for the end customer?

todos.title: Core Value
todos.body: Do your customers share the same core values or purpose of your company?

todos.title: Validation
todos.body: Do you setup systems to validate and test possible success of product before it is launched (Ex  crowdfunding websites like Kickstarter that only fund money if enough people invest)?

todos.title: Coopetition
todos.body: Do you partner with your competitors when it is advantageous to you in the long-run?

todos.title: Community & Crowd
todos.body: Do you leverage customers, community and crowd to grow your business (use statement of purpose to engage, nurture them, create a platform for peer-to-peer engagement, validating/rewarding their involvement, sweepstakes, quizzes, coupons, reward, loyalty, incentive competitions, ranking, peer pressure, feedback, clear rules, virtual currencies?

todos.title: Leveraged Assets
todos.body: Do you leverage assets/external resources instead of owning them in information companies and own assets instead of leveraging them in asset-heavy industries?

todos.title: Problem Space
todos.body: Do you know the problem space for your idea (something customer cannot solve or does not want to solve themselves/would rather pay someone else to solve)?

todos.title: Marketing
todos.body: Do you know how customers will find you?

todos.title: Social Technologies
todos.body: Do you invest in ways to support horizontal interactions between employees (reduce distance to obtain decisions and information, information flows and you Don’t have to look it up, task management, files sharing, telepresence, virtual worlds, emotional sensing)?

todos.title: A/B Testing
todos.body: Do you incorporate A/B testing (creating two different test campaigns of equal size and significant sampling and determining which one has higher success)?

todos.title: Approval/Decision
todos.body: Do you include employees, customers, and vendors in deciding which new ideas to pursue and who to hire?

todos.title: Dashboards
todos.body: Do you implement real-time and transparent dashboards with all essential company and employee metrics, accessible to everyone (OKR – Lists objectives, and key results to getting there)?

todos.title: Interfaces
todos.body: Do you implement filtering and matching processes into your products and systems (help manage abundance of information and cater it to users wants/needs)?

todos.title: Algorithms
todos.body: Do you have proprietary algorithms in place that drive your product (simple algorithms in complex and uncertain markets and complex algorithms in simple and predictable markets)?

todos.title: Staff on Demand
todos.body: Do you have access to staff on demand?

todos.title: Core Team Members
todos.body: Do you have a visionary, business/person, and executor (execution eats strategy for breakfast)?

todos.title: Statement of Purpose
todos.body: Do you have a strong statement of purpose that is something you are passionate about, massive, transformative (generates a cultural movement), and has a purpose?

todos.title: Net Promoter Score
todos.body: Do you have a strong net promoter score (how likely is it that you would recommend our company/product/service to a friend – score of 50% or more is good)?

todos.title: Red Ops
todos.body: Do you have a red ops team the tries to test security vulnerabilities?

todos.title: Black-Ops
todos.body: Do you have a black ops team that tries to disrupt your product and legacy?

todos.title: Experimentation
todos.body: Do you evolve and experiment with new and possibly risky ideas (Ex  give employees, customers, vendors a pre-paid credit card of $1,000 seed money and flexible guidelines to come up with a new idea/product, experimentation lab, managers must write two-page paper why an idea won’t work)?

todos.title: Good Failure
todos.body: Do you establish a system for determining between a good failure (done with integrity, done fast, done often, eliminates waste, still produces good results and lessons), bad failure (done w/o integrity, slow failure, lots of waste, there are no lessons to learn), good success (result of hard work and many tries and adaptations, know why it was a success), and bad success (result of luck with no tries and no idea why you became a success)?

todos.title: Use Data
todos.body: Data can improve hiring by 25% compared to strict intuition - American Psychological Association.

todos.title: Hard Drive Security
todos.body: Ban Thumb Drives at Work (90% of employees will plug in a thumb-drive left in parking lot which could infect computers)

todos.title: Job Creation
todos.body: 100% of net job creation has come via startups and entrepreneurs (2010 Kauffman Foundation study)

todos.title: * “Waste” is an expense that does not directly add value to your customer.
